intro: Tounatea panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian tounatea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. It produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. Tounatea panamensis is often found in tropical moist forests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
